content.raw:
Yes, at the moment the list of models which can be inserted from the menu is hardcoded. There should be better integration with the database soon.

One way to use your models right now is to create a `.world` file with the models inside and load it with `gzserver` before starting Gzweb. For example: 

1. Save [empty.world](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/2591f9537eaeaf1ae24a48d9e86f961a9c774980/worlds/empty.world?at=default) into a new file
2. Copy the `<model>` element of `gzweb/http/client/assets/<your model>/model.sdf`
3. Paste `<model>` into the world file,  before the `</world>` tag
4. Load the world: `gzserver <path>/<your world>.world`
content.html:
Yes, at the moment the list of models which can be inserted from the menu is hardcoded. There should be better integration with the database soon.

One way to use your models right now is to create a .world file with the models inside and load it with gzserver before starting Gzweb. For example:

  1. Save empty.world into a new file
  2. Copy the <model> element of gzweb/http/client/assets/<your model>/model.sdf
  3. Paste <model> into the world file, before the </world> tag
  4. Load the world: gzserver <path>/<your world>.world
